citation.name: Carcinogenesis
citation.title: Arachidonate lipoxygenase (ALOX) and cyclooxygenase (COX) polymorphisms and colon cancer risk.

comment.text: Catalyzes the first step in leukotriene biosynthesis, and thereby plays a role in inflammatory processes.
Interacts with ALOX5AP and LTC4S. Interacts with COTL1, the interaction is required for stability and efficient catalytic activity.

Shuttles between cytoplasm and nucleus. Found exclusively in the nucleus, when phosphorylated on Ser-272. Calcium binding promotes translocation from the cytosol and the nuclear matrix to the nuclear envelope and membrane association.
Serine phosphorylation by MAPKAPK2 is stimulated by arachidonic acid. Phosphorylation on Ser-523 by PKA has an inhibitory effect. Phosphorylation on Ser-272 prevents export from the nucleus.

comment.name: Atlas of Genetics and Cytogenetics in Oncology and Haematology

property.value: P:leukotriene production involved in inflammatory response

feature.description: Essential for stabilizing binding to COTL1
Loss of phosphorylation site. Permits export from the nucleus.
